What are you planning to parallelize in CUDA? The bottleneck in most
of the=
 experiments in neuroevolution is the fitness function, which is
very speci=
fic for each goal. I'd start parallelizing a particular set
of experiments =
than HyperNEAT alone.

Cesar

> Ken,
>
> Currently, the project is based =
on David D'Ambrosio's HyperSharpNeat v2.0.
> That library will undergo some=
 major changes to be compatible with CUDA, but
> I will=A0try=A0to keep it=
=A0backwardly compatible, if possible.=A0=A0The objective of
> the project =
is not to change the NEAT library, but is to explore issues of

m in implementing it on CUDA.

cture of the library to partition
